body:
### Problem

Possibly suboptimal combination of soft-wrap and lack of horizontal scrolling in some programming environments.

### Expected behavior

Hi, just wanted to gather people's thoughts on the following possible feature:

Soft-wrap (non destructive) is done not at window's boundary, nor at a fixed
amount for every line.

Instead, the said soft-wrap margin is a user-defined constant offset but it
does *not* count leading whitespace (e.g. indentation) for any given line.

So if a given line has first non-whitespace char starting at column 0 (i.e.
line is not indented), and the said margin value is 80, then the line will be
soft-wrapped between columns 0 and 80.

If, on the other hand, some line is shifted/indented to the right so that it's
first non-whitespace char starts at line 10, then the wrap margin for this line
will be at column 90 (i.e. 10 + 80)... e.g. one option would be to soft-wrap
between columns 10 and 90 :)

This way if one has multiple paragraphs (say one starting at column 0, no
indent; another paragraph is heavily indented to the right) -- then both
paragraphs would be of the same width.

At the same time though: *still* have horizontal scrolling enabled (thus enabling to 
move across text freely) in the whole buffer/window/editor.

If the above is to be considered in the context of programming where:

1) some code blocks have heavily-nested indentation (fact of life, since one
cannot control all the code out there :)

2) users have different monitor-widths, font-sizes, eyesight conditions (so
hard-wrapping, or even doing so manually at a time of writing code, to a given
'paragraph width' may not be equally optimal to all users).

... then we would be able to avoid having a lot of wasted space on the left
with very tall and narrow code at far right (wrap on); whilst at the same time
not having to scroll too much for very long lines (wrap off)...

... and without forcing hard-wrapping/-formatting on every user with
potentially different monitor resolutions and font sizes;

... or without forcing different users to 'hard reformat' code differently to
their own desires thereby leading to danger of confusing 'diffs' when such code
is committed to the shared repo, etc.

milestone.description: We don't plan to work on this, but will accept high quality contributions from someone who will own the feature and follow up on bug reports.
milestone.title: needs-owner

title: Dynamic (not same for every line) soft-wrap margin... and *without* disabling buffer-wide horizontal scrolling.
